#
What?
--- [![build](https://github.com/kojix2/lolcat.cr/actions/workflows/build.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/kojix2/lolcat.cr/actions/workflows/build.yml) [![Lines of Code](https://img.shields.io/endpoint?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftokei.kojix2.net%2Fbadge%2Fgithub%2Fkojix2%2Flolcat.cr%2Flines)](https://tokei.kojix2.net/github/kojix2/lolcat.cr) :black_cat: Crystal implementation of the [lolcat](https://github.com/busyloop/lolcat) ## Installation Download from [GitHub Release](https://github.com/kojix2/lolcat.cr/releases) From source code: ```sh git clone https://github.com/kojix2/lolcat.cr cd lolcat.cr shards build --release mv bin/lolcat /usr/local/bin/ # or any directory in your PATH ``` Homebrew: ```sh brew install kojix2/brew/lolcat ``` ## Usage ```sh lolcat README.md ``` ```sh lolcat --help ``` As a library You can use lolcat.cr as a library in your Crystal projects: ```yaml # Add to your shard.yml dependencies: lolcat: github: kojix2/lolcat.cr ``` Basic usage: ```crystal require "lolcat" # Use the Lol module directly include Lolcat::Lol # Create options with default values options = Lolcat::Options.new # Apply rainbow colors to a string colored_text = rainbow_line("Hello, colorful world!", options, 0.0) puts colored_text # Or process an entire IO stream io = IO::Memory.new("Multiple\nLines\nOf\nText") lol_cat(io, options) ``` For more examples, see [examples](examples/) ## Development This project was created as an example of a command line tool. Use only standard libraries and keep it simple. ## Contributing Pull requests and issues are welcome. ## License The original lolcat is licensed under the BSD 3-Clause "New" or "Revised" License. Thus, the same is true for this project.

class_methods.name: cat
class_methods.doc:
Print a file with rainbow colors

- If offset is not provided, it will be random.
- If force is true, it will force color output even if stdout is not a TTY.
class_methods.args_string: (path : Path, spread : Float64 = 3.0, freq : Float64 = 0.1, offset : Float64 | Nil = nil, invert : Bool = false, force : Bool = false) : Nil
class_methods.args_html: (path : Path, spread : Float64 = 3.0, freq : Float64 = 0.1, offset : Float64 | Nil = nil, invert : Bool = false, force : Bool = false) : Nil

def.name: cat
def.body:
offset_f64 = offset || (rand * 256.0)
options = Lolcat::Options.new(spread: spread, freq: freq, offset: offset_f64, invert: invert, force: force)

File.open(path) do |file|
  Lolcat::Lol.lol_cat(file, options)
end

class_methods.name: lol
class_methods.doc:
Get a rainbow string line by line

- If offset is not provided, it will be random.

Example:
```
Lolcat.lol("Rainbow string", invert: true) do |line|
  print line
end
```
class_methods.summary: Get a rainbow string line by line
class_methods.args_string: (input, spread : Float64 = 3.0, freq : Float64 = 0.1, offset : Float64 | Nil = nil, invert : Bool = false, &) : Nil
class_methods.args_html: (input, spread : Float64 = 3.0, freq : Float64 = 0.1, offset : Float64 | Nil = nil, invert : Bool = false, &) : Nil

def.name: lol
def.body:
offset_f64 = offset || (rand * 256.0)
options = Lolcat::Options.new(spread: spread, freq: freq, offset: offset_f64, invert: invert, force: true)

Lolcat::Lol.lol(input, options) do |line|
  yield line
end

Runs the program with the parsed options.

This is the main entry point that executes the appropriate action
based on the parsed command line arguments.
instance_methods.summary: Runs the program with the parsed options.

def.name: run
def.body:
begin
  parse_args
  case option.action
  when Action::Lolcat
    run_lolcat
  when Action::Version
    print_version
  when Action::Help
    print_help
  else
    raise(ArgumentError.new("Invalid action: #{option.action}"))
  end
rescue ex
  handle_error(ex)
end

types.doc:
The Lol module contains the core functionality for colorizing text with rainbow colors.

This module provides methods to process text input (from strings or IO) and
apply rainbow colors to each character. It handles ANSI escape sequences,
animation effects, and various customization options.
types.summary: The Lol module contains the core functionality for colorizing text with rainbow colors.

instance_methods.name: lol
instance_methods.doc:
Processes a string input and yields each colorized line.

This is a convenience overload that converts a string to an IO::Memory
and delegates to the IO version of this method.

input: The string to process
options: Configuration options for the colorization
yield: Each processed line is yielded to the block
instance_methods.summary: Processes a string input and yields each colorized line.

def.name: lol
def.body: lol(IO::Memory.new(input), options) do |line| yield line end

instance_methods.name: lol
instance_methods.doc:
Processes an IO input and yields each colorized line.

This method reads from the input IO in chunks, processes each line,
and yields the colorized output. It handles ANSI escape sequences
and maintains line numbering for proper rainbow color progression.

input: The IO to read from
options: Configuration options for the colorization
yield: Each processed line is yielded to the block
instance_methods.summary: Processes an IO input and yields each colorized line.

def.name: lol
def.body:
buffer = IO::Memory.new
chunk = Bytes.new(4096)
line_number = 0
bytes_read = 0
cursor_position = 0

while (bytes_read = input.read(chunk)) > 0
  buffer.write(chunk[0, bytes_read])
  buffer_content = buffer.to_s

  if buffer_content =~ INCOMPLETE_ESCAPE
    next
  end

  buffer_content.each_line(chomp: false) do |line|
    line_number, cursor_position = clip_tail(line, line_number, cursor_position, options) do |lin| yield lin end
  end

  buffer.clear
end

instance_methods.name: lol_cat
instance_methods.doc:
Processes input and prints it with rainbow colors.

This is the main function for displaying colorized text to the terminal.
It handles both string and IO inputs, applies rainbow colors, and manages
terminal state (cursor visibility, etc.).

input: The text to colorize (either a String or IO)
options: Configuration options for the colorization
instance_methods.summary: Processes input and prints it with rainbow colors.

def.name: lol_cat
def.body:
begin
  options.force? ? Colorize.enabled = true : Colorize.on_tty_only!
  if options.animate?
    print(HIDE_CURSOR)
  end
  lol(input, options) do |line| print(line) end
ensure
  if STDOUT.tty? || options.force?
    print("#{RESET_ATTRIBUTES}#{SHOW_CURSOR}#{RESET_TERMINAL_MODES}")
  end
end

instance_methods.name: rainbow_color
instance_methods.doc:
Calculates RGB color values for a rainbow effect based on frequency and offset.

This function uses sine waves with different phase shifts to generate
smooth transitions between colors in the rainbow spectrum.

freq: Controls how quickly the colors change
offset: Position in the color cycle

Returns a tuple of RGB values as UInt8 (0-255)
instance_methods.summary: Calculates RGB color values for a rainbow effect based on frequency and offset.
instance_methods.args_string: (freq : Float64, offset : Float64) : Tuple(UInt8, UInt8, UInt8)
instance_methods.args_html: (freq : Float64, offset : Float64) : Tuple(UInt8, UInt8, UInt8)

instance_methods.name: rainbow_line
instance_methods.doc:
Applies rainbow colors to a line of text based on line number and position.

This overload calculates the appropriate offset based on line number and position,
then delegates to the offset-based version of this method.

line: The line of text to colorize
options: Configuration options for the colorization
index: The line number (used for color progression)
pos: The cursor position (used for color progression)

Returns a string with rainbow colors applied
instance_methods.summary: Applies rainbow colors to a line of text based on line number and position.
instance_methods.args_string: (line : String, options : Options, index : Int32, pos : Int32) : String
instance_methods.args_html: (line : String, options : Options, index : Int32, pos : Int32) : String

def.name: rainbow_line
def.body:
offset = (options.offset + index) + (pos / options.spread)
rainbow_line(line, options, offset)

instance_methods.name: rainbow_line
instance_methods.doc:
Applies rainbow colors to a line of text based on a specific offset.

This is the core method that applies rainbow colors to each character in a line.
It handles ANSI escape sequences and applies colors to visible characters only.

line: The line of text to colorize
options: Configuration options for the colorization
offset: The color offset to use (determines the starting color)

Returns a string with rainbow colors applied
instance_methods.summary: Applies rainbow colors to a line of text based on a specific offset.
instance_methods.args_string: (line : String, options : Options, offset : Float64) : String

def.name: rainbow_line
def.body:
String.build do |str|
  char_position = 0

  line.scan(ANSI_ESCAPE) do |match|
    escape_sequence = match[1]?
    character = match[2]?


    if escape_sequence
      str << escape_sequence
    end


    if character
      off_set = offset + (char_position / options.spread)
      color = rainbow_color(options.freq, off_set)

      if options.invert?
        str << (character.colorize.back(*color))
      else
        str << (character.colorize.fore(*color))
      end

      char_position = char_position + 1
    end
  end
end
